comment: Very helpful and straightforward.  Goes straight by the book.  But I really needed to step up my game. Tests were difficult.
She is not a great teacher. She really knows her math and content, she just can't seem to convey it easily.

If you can get another teacher please do so, I would even recommend waiting until next semester if at all possible. She just is not a good teacher, plain and simple. She spent class time letting students do problems on the board (which I thought was extremely elementary) and then she spend minimal time going over those problems herself..
Even if you know pre calculus from high school, you still going to have problem doing her test? DON?T TAKE HER?..she is the worst professor ever, the tests are almost impossible to do?RUUUUUNNNNNNN

Professor Keener only speaks in math language. Good thing I had taken precalc before I came to college. Her teaching is very strange. She doesnt teach you what is going to be on the tests. As well her tests dont come from my math lab either. She is very smart but needs to come back down to earth so students can understand her.

Professor Keener is very difficult to understand. She is almost too smart for her own good and comes off as very snobby and stuck up. Her lectures are hard to follow and she gives very short, blank tests. Nice lady, bad prof.

Very nice teacher, def easy on the eyes also. I am horrible at math and I passed this class. Do your hw and you will be fine. Quizzes are easy but test difficult. Have to make sure you do the MML assignments also.

A very condescending and rude person. Didn't teach worth a dime and she wouldn't help you out, either. She's not a real professor, just an assistant-type deal, so if you show up for someone else and she's there, DROP THAT CLASS.

Avoid! Makes precal abnormally difficult. Very unclear when teaching and what will be on tests. Expects everyone to naturally know the material. Dont ask too many questions, will hold grudges. Taught myself from text and MML. HW is important. I made a B, but should of had an A. Worst teacher I have ever had.

Avoid! Made a precalc class way more difficult than it should have been. Very unclear when teaching and expects everyone to naturally know the material. Dont ask questions, will hold grudges if she doesnt like you. Uses the textbook a lot. had to teach myself from book and MML. Unclear what she will put on test. I made a B, should have had an A.

My high school math teachers were miles ahead of this lady... She doesn't explain ANYTHING on an understandable level and makes the most basic of equations seem like astrophysics. She is, however, approachable and does make attempts to help if you're struggling.
